lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Riegle, the chairman of the Senate securities subcommittee, said he wanted to act on the legislation this year, but Thomas Moore, a member of the President's Council of Economic Advisors, said action should be delayed until the Supreme Court ruled on the appearl of an insider trading conviction by former Wall Street Journal reporter R.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Acting SEC chairman Charles Cox told the Senate Banking Committee a bill proposed this week to define insider trading as the wrongful use of material nonpublic information was good but contained some ambiguous provisions which might reduce the Commission's flexibility in prosecuting cases.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: President Reagan nominated Northwestern University law professor David Ruder as SEC chairman on Wednesday, but he may not be confirmed by the Senate for several weeks.

lst.name: sentence
